meanings.definition: Deprive of an endowment or endowments.
meanings.sent1: The charity decided to disendow the scholarship fund.
meanings.sent2: The university had to disendow the professorship due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a surprise if they suddenly disendowed the library endowment.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disendow the once lush garden of its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disendow the trust left many students without financial support.

meanings.definition: To take away an endowment from.
meanings.sent1: The board voted to disendow the museum of its valuable art collection.
meanings.sent2: The family had to disendow the foundation to cover unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent3: It was a strange twist of fate to disendow the historical society of its artifacts.
meanings.sent4: The harsh reality disendowed the town of its once thriving economy.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disendow the charity shocked many donors.
